programme.title: ... Tick... Tick... Tick...
programme.desc: A newly elected sheriff (Jim Brown) gets help from his predecessor (George Kennedy) and the mayor (Fredric March) in a racially torn Southern town.

programme.title: Hit Man
programme.desc: An avenger (Bernie Casey) wades through the Los Angeles porno underworld in the name of his dead brother.

programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Two military madmen (Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey) hijack a nuclear-armed Navy battleship with a SEAL commando (Steven Seagal) on board as a cook.

programme.title: Beach of the War Gods
programme.desc: A knight rallies humble fishermen to fight Japanese pirates.

programme.title: Karate Frightmare
programme.desc: Two kung fu masters hire assassins to murder two of their rivals.

programme.title: Battle Creek Brawl
programme.desc: In the 1930s, an effete Chicago mobster (Jose Ferrer) pits a Chinese kicker (Jackie Chan) against a king-size brute called Kiss.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: Coming To Soul Flix...El Condor, The Learning Tree, The Omega Man, Caged Heat, Dolemite.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Former heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali; South African born singer Miriam Makeba; the Delfonics; guest-host Nikki Giovanni opens with her Kidnap Poem.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Singer Jerry Butler headlines with his back-up group, Peaches; highlights of their numbers are "Make It Easy on Yourself" and "Brand New Me."

programme.title: Soul!
programme.sub-title: Lee Morgan; Horace Silver; Bobbi Humphrey
programme.desc: Jazz lineup features pianist Horace Silver at the electric keyboard, Lee Morgan on trumpet and 22-year old Bobbi Humphrey playing the flute; vocalists Andy and Salome Bey.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: One of the great Motown acts of the past several years headlines, performing the hit, "I Heard It through the Grapevine," and other selections.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: Coming To Soul Flix...The New Barbarians, Sparkle, Cleopatra Jones, Greased Lightning, Under Siege, Freedom Road, Shaft, The Learning Tree, Action Jackson, Under the Cherry Moon, Graffiti Bridge.

programme.title: Mean Johnny Barrows
programme.desc: A Vietnam veteran (Fred Williamson) gets caught in a mob war with a couple of double-crossers (Jenny Sherman, Roddy McDowall).

programme.title: Black Eye
programme.desc: An ex-police officer operating a private detective business comes face to face with a syndicate-backed dope ring.

programme.title: Coming Soon to Soul Flix
programme.desc: Coming To Soul Flix... Arena, The Big Doll House, Caged Heat Assault on Precinct 13, The Bad Bunch and others.

programme.title: Black Fist
programme.desc: To make money, a Los Angeles street-fighter goes to work for gangsters.

programme.title: Lady Cocoa
programme.desc: Thugs try to kill a woman (Lola Falana) released from prison before she can testify against her boyfriend.

programme.title: TNT Jackson
programme.desc: A woman (Jeanne Bell) encounters thugs and drug dealers after traveling to Hong Kong to search for her missing brother.
